member.name: T:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.NetVersions
member.summary: A class to get the versions of .NET installed on the local computer. Only relevant for Windows.

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.NetVersions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Other operating systems will just list no versions of .NET (until there might be support at a later date).

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.NetVersions.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.
member.returns: An enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection of .NET versions found.

member.name: T:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinArchitecture
member.summary: The processor architecture on which the machine is running.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinArchitecture.IA64
member.summary: Intel IA64 architecture (this is not x64).

member.name: T:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinPlatform
member.summary: List of various platform IDs provided by Microsoft.

member.name: T:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinProductInfo
member.summary: The Operating System Product Info. Supported in Vista and later.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinProductInfo.Server_For_SmallBusiness
member.summary: Windows Server 2008 for Windows Essential Server Solutions.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinProductInfo.MediumBusiness_Server_Management
member.summary: Windows Essential Business Server Management Server.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinProductInfo.MediumBusiness_Server_Security
member.summary: Windows Essential Business Server Security Server.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinProductInfo.MediumBusiness_Server_Messaging
member.summary: Windows Essential Business Server Messaging Server.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinProductInfo.Server_For_SmallBusiness_V
member.summary: Windows Server 2008 without Hyper-V for Windows Essential Server Solutions.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinProductInfo.EssentialBusiness_Server_MgmtSvc
member.summary: Windows Essential Server Solution Management SVC.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinProductInfo.EssentialBusiness_Server_AddlSvc
member.summary: Windows Essential Server Solution Additional SVC.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinProductType.Win9x
member.summary: Windows 9x, 32-bit, referring to Windows 95, 95OSR2, 98, 98SE, or ME.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinProductType.Workstation
member.summary: The operating system is Windows 8, Windows 7, Windows Vista, Windows XP Professional, Windows XP Home Edition, or Windows 2000 Professional.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinProductType.DomainController
member.summary: The system is a domain controller and the operating system is Windows Server 2012 , Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2003, or Windows 2000 Server.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinProductType.Server
member.summary: The operating system is Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2003, or Windows 2000 Server. Note that a server that is also a domain controller is reported as VER_NT_DOMAIN_CONTROLLER, not VER_NT_SERVER.

member.name: T:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinSuite
member.remarks: This field is derived from OSVERSIONINFOEX.wSuiteMask.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinSuite.SmallBusiness
member.summary: Microsoft Small Business Server was once installed on the system, but may have been upgraded to another version of Windows. You should not rely upon only the SmallBusiness flag to determine whether Small Business Server has been installed on the system, as both this flag and the flag are set when this product suite is installed. If you upgrade this installation to Windows Server, Standard Edition, the flag will be cleared however, the flag will remain set. In this case, this indicates that Small Business Server was once installed on this system. If this installation is further upgraded to Windows Server, Enterprise Edition, the flag will remain set.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinSuite.Enterprise
member.summary: Windows Server 2008 Enterprise, Windows Server 2003, Enterprise Edition, or Windows 2000 Advanced Server is installed.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinSuite.Terminal
member.summary: Terminal Services is installed. This value is always set. If Terminal is set but SingleUserTS is not set, the system is running in application server mode.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinSuite.SmallBusinessRestricted
member.summary: Microsoft Small Business Server is installed with the restrictive client license in force.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinSuite.Datacenter
member.summary: Windows Server 2008 Datacenter, Windows Server 2003, Datacenter Edition, or Windows 2000 Datacenter Server is installed.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinSuite.SingleUserTS
member.summary: Remote Desktop is supported, but only one interactive session is supported. This value is set unless the system is running in application server mode.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinSuite.Personal
member.summary: Windows Vista Home Premium, Windows Vista Home Basic, or Windows XP Home Edition is installed.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinSuite.Blade
member.summary: Windows Server 2003, Web Edition is installed.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinSuite.StorageServer
member.summary: Windows Storage Server 2003 R2 or Windows Storage Server 2003is installed.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinSuite.ComputeServer
member.summary: Windows Server 2003, Compute Cluster Edition is installed.

member.name: T:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersionQuery
member.summary: Class to get information about the local machine.

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersionQuery.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor, getting information about the local machine. Use the static method LocalMachine instead for efficiency.

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersionQuery.GetVersionEx
member.remarks: We use the Microsoft recommended way of getting the Operating System Version using GetVersionEx(), first with OSVERSIONINFO and then with OSVERSIONINFOEX if supported.
member.returns: if we successfully retrieved OS version information.

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersionQuery.GetVersion
member.summary: In case we couldn't get the version using the recommended way.
member.remarks: See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms724439%28VS.85%29.aspx. This method doesn't support WinCE, as we don't get information about the platform ID. Win32s is determined by the upper bit in the system and then by the operating system version number.

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersionQuery.GetNativeVersion
member.summary: A method to get OS information natively from the .NET subsystem.
member.returns: if the information could be obtained; otherwise.

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersionQuery.GetProductInfo
member.summary: Get product information that is available in Windows Vista and later.

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersionQuery.CalculateWinVersion(RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion)
member.summary: Calculates the Windows version for a non-exact match.
member.param: The last match.
member.returns: A string that should be presented to the user.
member.remarks: This class has an internal database of Windows Versions obtained from MSDN. It might be that the internal database is out of date, applications can override this to provide more accurate information.

member.name: T:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion
member.summary: Base class for containing Operating System Version Information for Windows based Systems.
member.remarks: This class represents information about a particular Windows Operating System. To get information about your system, use the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for a specific Windows version with a CSD.
member.param: The Platform ID to define.
The minor version of the OS.
The major version of the OS.
A null-terminated string, such as "Service Pack 3", that indicates the latest Service Pack installed on the system. If no Service Pack has been installed, the string is empty.

member.name: P:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion.LocalMachine
member.summary: Get the version of the OS that we're running on.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion.WinVersionDatabase
member.remarks: Entries in the database are searched from top to bottom. Items marked as Unknown, -1, Empty, Unknown or false are not compared. The first entry is taken and returned. An OSProductType of DomainController will also match OSProductType.Server for convenience. See for how to sort this table.

member.name: P:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion.IsServer
member.summary: Returns if the current object represents a server.
member.remarks: If the Operating system is configured as a DomainController or a Server, this property returns .

member.summary: The Operating System Major Service Pack number.

member.summary: The Operating System Minor Service Pack number.

member.name: P:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion.ServerR2
member.summary: The Operating System release type, if this is an R2 release (Windows 2003 only).

member.name: P:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion.ProductInfo
member.summary: The Operating System Product Information flags.

member.name: P:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion.Version
member.summary: The Operating System as a Version string.
member.remarks: The Major and Minor version numbers correspond to the Operating System major and minor number. For example, Windows 7 has a version of "6.2". If the build number is provided, this is given as the third digit. If there is a service pack version, this is provided in the fourth field, with the lowest byte being the service pack minor version, the upper byte being the service pack major number.

member.name: P:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion.VersionString
member.summary: Get the Operating System version as a string.

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion.CalculateWinVersion(RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion)
member.summary: Calculates the Windows version for a non-exact match.
member.param: The Windows version.
member.returns: A string that should be presented to the user.
member.remarks: This class has an internal database of Windows Versions obtained from MSDN. It might be that the internal database is out of date, applications can override this to provide more accurate information.

member.name: P:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion.WinVersionString
member.summary: Get the Windows version as a simple string, the same as the Enum value OSVersionKind.

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified is equal to this instance.
member.param: The to compare with this instance.
member.returns: if the specified is equal to this instance; otherwise, .

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion.op_Equality(RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion,RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion)
member.summary: Compares two OSVersion objects if they are the same.
member.remarks:
Two OSVersion objects are the same if they have the same major, minor, build, service pack and OSVersionKind.
You can use this to check if your operating system, returned by the OSVerQuery class is the same as a predefined object, e.g. Win95, Vista, Win7, etc.
member.param: The first OSVersion object.
The second OSVersion object.
member.returns: true if the objects match.

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion.op_Inequality(RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion,RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion)
member.summary: Compares two OSVersion objects if they are the same.
member.remarks:
Two OSVersion objects are different if they have the any differences in major, minor, build, service pack or OSVersionKind.
You can use this to check if your operating system, returned by the OSVerQuery class is the same as a predefined object, e.g. Win95, Vista, Win7, etc.
member.param: The first OSVersion object.
The second OSVersion object.
member.returns: true if the versions do not match.

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion.op_LessThan(RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion,RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion)
member.summary: Compares two OSVersion objects for versions.
member.remarks:
Versions are compared against the major, minor, build and then the service pack. If they all match, then the enumeration is finally checked in the order defined.
You can use this to check if your operating system, returned by the OSVerQuery class against a predefined object, e.g. Win95, Vista, Win7, etc.
member.param: The first OSVersion object.
The second OSVersion object.
member.returns: true if the first is older than the second.

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion.op_GreaterThan(RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion,RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion)
member.summary: Compares two OSVersion objects for versions.
member.remarks:
Versions are compared against the major, minor, build and then the service pack. If they all match, then the enumeration is finally checked in the order defined.
You can use this to check if your operating system, returned by the OSVerQuery class against a predefined object, e.g. Win95, Vista, Win7, etc.
member.param: The first OSVersion object.
The second OSVersion object.
member.returns: true if the first is newer than the second.

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion.op_LessThanOrEqual(RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion,RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion)
member.summary: Compares two OSVersion objects for versions.
member.remarks:
Versions are compared against the major, minor, build and then the service pack. If they all match, then the enumeration is finally checked in the order defined.
You can use this to check if your operating system, returned by the OSVerQuery class against a predefined object, e.g. Win95, Vista, Win7, etc.
member.param: The first OSVersion object.
The second OSVersion object.
member.returns: true if the first is older or the same as the second.

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion.op_GreaterThanOrEqual(RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion,RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion)
member.summary: Compares two OSVersion objects for versions.
member.remarks:
Versions are compared against the major, minor, build and then the service pack. If they all match, then the enumeration is finally checked in the order defined.
You can use this to check if your operating system, returned by the OSVerQuery class against a predefined object, e.g. Win95, Vista, Win7, etc.
member.param: The first OSVersion object.
The second OSVersion object.
member.returns: true if the first is newer or the same as the second.

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Version.WinVersion.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares an OSVersion object against this object.
member.remarks:
Versions are compared against the major, minor, build and then the service pack. If they all match, then the enumeration is finally checked in the order defined.
You can use this to check if your operating system, returned by the OSVerQuery class against a predefined object, e.g. Win95, Vista, Win7, etc.
member.param: The other OSVersion object.
member.returns: -1 indicates that this object is older than the other OSVersion. 0 indicates they are the same. 1 indicates this object is newer than the other OSVersion.

member.name: T:RJCP.Core.Environment.Platform
member.summary: Utility class providing OS specific functionality.

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Platform.IsWinNT
member.summary: Determines whether the operating system is Windows NT or later.
member.returns: if the operating system is Windows NT or later; otherwise, .

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Platform.IsUnix
member.summary: Determines whether the operating system is a supported version of a Unix based system.
member.returns: if the operating system is a supported version of a Unix based system; otherwise, .
member.remarks: The method is meant to be compatible with both the .NET CLR and the MONO framework. Details of how to detect the platform under MONO can be found at http://www.mono-project.com/docs/faq/technical/#how-to-detect-the-execution-platform

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Platform.GetFolderPath(System.Environment.SpecialFolder)
member.summary: Gets the path to the system special folder that is identified by the specified enumeration.
member.param: An enumerated constant that identifies a system special folder.
member.returns: The path to the specified system special folder, if that folder physically exists on your computer; otherwise, an empty string ( ). A folder will not physically exist if the operating system did not create it, the existing folder was deleted, or the folder is a virtual directory, such as , which does not correspond to a physical path.
member.exception: The caller doesn't have permissions to read environment variables.
Unable to determine the location of the home directory.
member.remarks: This method can be used in place of the .NET . On Windows, it will return the same results. On Linux, it will initially apply the XDG specifications for folder paths, and if not available, will fall back to .

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Platform.IsMonoClr
member.summary: Determines if the software is running on top of the Mono Common Language Runtime.
member.returns: if running on the Mono CLR; otherwise, .

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Platform.IsMSys
member.summary: Determines if the process is started from an MSys Shell
member.returns: Returns the system is running from an MSys shell, otherwise, .

member.name: T:RJCP.Core.Environment.Xdg
member.summary: A class to implement portions of the XDG Base Directory Specification.
member.remarks: The XDG specification is for Unix like operating systems. Please refer to https://specifications.freedesktop.org/basedir-spec/basedir-spec-0.7.html

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Xdg.GetFolderPath(RJCP.Core.Environment.Xdg.SpecialFolder)
member.summary: Gets the folder path for a specific .
member.param: The special folder value to obtain.
member.returns: A path in the native format.
member.exception: The value of is not known.
The caller doesn't have permissions to read environment variables.
The platform is not supported. Only Windows NT and Unix platforms are supported.
Unable to determine the location of the home directory.
member.remarks:
This function fulfills the XDG Base Specification v0.7 and is intended for usage only on Unix like operating systems. Environment variables defined in the XDG specification are for Unix like operating systems and are interpreted as such. No variable substitution is done within the environment variables from the XDG specification and must be expanded prior.
When determining the home directory, the $HOME is used on Unix like operating systems. If the $HOME environment variable is not defined, the root directory path '/' is used. On Windows NT operating systems, the local application directory from the system is returned (as referred to enumeration).

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Xdg.ResolveFile(RJCP.Core.Environment.Xdg.SpecialFolder,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the full path to the file name, relative to the special folder provided.
member.param: The special folder base directory.
Name of the file to resolve.
member.returns: A path in the native format.
member.remarks: For some folder paths (specifically, only and , a set of paths may be searched if a file is not found in the current home directory. This should be the function used when identifying a file for loading from disk. Use the method for getting a path when writing a file to disk.

member.name: M:RJCP.Core.Environment.Xdg.ResolveDirectory(RJCP.Core.Environment.Xdg.SpecialFolder,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the full path to the directory name, relative to the special folder provided.
member.param: The special folder base directory.
Name of the directory to resolve.
member.returns: A path in the native format.
member.remarks: For some folder paths (specifically, only and , a set of paths may be searched if a file is not found in the current home directory. This should be the function used when identifying a file for loading from disk. Use the method for getting a path when writing a file to disk.

member.name: T:RJCP.Core.Environment.Xdg.SpecialFolder
member.summary: Specifies enumerated constants used to retrieve directory paths to system special folders.

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Xdg.SpecialFolder.LocalApplicationData
member.summary: Directory location for local application data (default is $HOME/.local/share).

member.name: F:RJCP.Core.Environment.Xdg.SpecialFolder.CommonApplicationData
member.summary: The common application data, or configuration data (default is $HOME/.config).
